Hey all.  I saw the thread about King's Quest, so I thought I'd share this.

After Sierra (now owned by Vivendi) decided it wasn't going to make anymore adventure games, some fans got together to make their own King's Quest fan game.  After it was finished, they planned to offer it as a free download to anyone who was interested.  These fans were doing this for no other reason than they loved King's Quest, and they wanted to pay homage to the series.

After over three years of work, they were about to release it in December.  However, just a couple of weeks ago, Vivendi issued a cease & desist letter -- essentially shutting the game down.

A group of fans, including myself, have joined forces in an effort to save the game.  We launched a website, focusing on an email campaign.

[url:ke97omep]http://www.savekqix.org[/url:ke97omep]

We setup an email link, where the message is already pre-written and ready to go.  It literally only takes 10 seconds for someone to send an email to Vivendi.

We're also on MySpace.  If anyone is on over there, feel free to add us to your friends list.
[url:ke97omep]http://www.myspace.com/savekqix[/url:ke97omep]

Take care,

Matt

P.S.  The website of the game itself is:
[url:ke97omep]http://www.kqix.com[/url:ke97omep]
